connector.description: Expose HTTP endpoints using the HTTP server available in the current platform.

camel.source.path.path.name: camel.source.path.path
camel.source.path.path.description: The path under which this endpoint serves the HTTP requests

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.consumes.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumes
camel.source.endpoint.consumes.description: The content type this endpoint accepts as an input, such as application/xml or application/json. null or */* mean no restriction.

camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict.name: camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict
camel.source.endpoint.httpMethodRestrict.description: A comma separated list of HTTP methods to serve, e.g. GET,POST . If no methods are specified, all methods will be served.

camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix
camel.source.endpoint.matchOnUriPrefix.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

camel.source.endpoint.produces.name: camel.source.endpoint.produces
camel.source.endpoint.produces.description: The content type this endpoint produces, such as application/xml or application/json.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.fileNameExtWhiteli.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileNameExtWhitelist
camel.source.endpoint.fileNameExtWhiteli.description: A comma or whitespace separated list of file extensions. Uploads having these extensions will be stored locally. Null value or asterisk () will allow all files.

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers to and from Camel message.

camel.source.endpoint.platformHttpEngine.name: camel.source.endpoint.platformHttpEngine
camel.source.endpoint.platformHttpEngine.description: An HTTP Server engine implementation to serve the requests of this endpoint.

camel.component.platform-http.bridgeErro.name: camel.component.platform-http.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.platform-http.bridgeErro.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.platform-http.autowiredE.name: camel.component.platform-http.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.platform-http.autowiredE.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.platform-http.engine.name: camel.component.platform-http.engine
camel.component.platform-http.engine.description: An HTTP Server engine implementation to serve the requests
